results.title: The Nostradamus kid
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, Beyond Films and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description: Ken Elkin (Noah Taylor) an over-sexed, hyperactive youth with a taste for personal melodrama, first encounters the end of the world at the annual Seventh Day Adventist Camp in 1956. Convinced by an eloquent heretic that all Adventists are to burn in hell the following Saturday, Elkin fears that his true love for the pastors’ daughter will never be consummated - but the world doesn’t end. Arriving in Sydney in 1962 to attend University, Elkin encounters the world’s end for a second time while besieging the wealthy and beautiful Jennie O’Brien (Miranda Otto) with his misguided affection. Believing that with the Cuba Missile Crisis the end of world is truly nigh, the paranoid Elkin persuades Jennie to flee Sydney for the safety of the nearby mountains. However, the much longed for apocalypse is once again postponed and he returns to face the wrath of Jennie’s father. Cast also includes Arthur Dignam, Jack Campbell and Erik Mitsak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, Beyond Films and Bob Ellis

results.title: The Nose, throat and ears
results.brief_description: Describes the structure and functions of these organs. Shows that, although they are separate organs, they are all lined with a continuous mucous membrane and that infection in one may lead to infection in the others.
results.description: Describes the structure and functions of these organs. Shows that, although they are separate organs, they are all lined with a continuous mucous membrane and that infection in one may lead to infection in the others.

results.title: The Nose = Le Nez
results.creator_credit: Cinema Nouveau, Alexandre Alexeieff and Claire Parker
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Nicoli Gogol and drawn on pinboard, tells of a young man who unwittingly loses his nose at the barbers. After an unsuccessful and exhausting search, the nose is returned to him. Next morning he calls again at the barbers for a shave.

results.title: The Northern Territory
results.brief_description: A broad view of developments in the Territory, showing the wide range of mineral resources being exploited, the expansion of the cattle industry and new industries, and the improvement of transport.

results.title: The Northern run
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The story of the Queensland Coast and Torres Strait Pilot Service told by four of the master mariners of the service. Each year the pilots take some 1500 overseas and coastal vessels through these hazardous but beautiful parts. Beneath the beauty of the Great Barrier Reef there are hazards; strong tidal streams, saw-toothed reefs, the skeletons of wrecked ships, and other menaces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove

results.title: The Northern Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The love of minutely observed detail is one of the characteristics that distinguishes the art of the Northern Renaissance from that of Italy. Although the Italians too, studied the surfaces of things, their intent was to work from the inner form outwards, seeking an organising principle or harmony outlying outward appearances. It is in the work of Jan van Eyck and the master Albrecht Durer, that the style of the Northern Renaissance is best showcased.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

results.title: The North wind and the sun: an Aesop fable
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Combining old world and modern elements, this colorful animated film tells the story of a contest between the north wind and the sun. “You can sometimes do more by being gentle than you can by using force” is the useful lesson children will gain from this film.
results.title_for_label: The North wind and the sun: an Aesop fable

results.title: The North Sea: where do you draw the line
results.creator_credit: Peter Clark, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Looks at the question of where the line should be drawn in relation to off-shore boundaries, fishing quotas, gravel extraction, pollution limits and storm surges in the North Sea. Suitable for upper secondary level.
